abstract.abstracttext:
To compare the efficacy and tolerability of a once daily evening dose of
bimatoprost/timolol
fixed combination with that of a once daily evening dose of
latanoprost/timolol
fixed combination in patients not controlled with prostaglandins analogues monotherapy.

A total of 82
patients
on prostaglandin analogues monotherapy were enrolled in this prospective, multicenter, investigator masked, clinical study and were randomized to either Bimatoprost/Timolol (_POP_) or Latanoprost/Timolol Fixed Combination (_POP_) topical therapy once at night for _POFT_. The primary endpoint of the study was to compare the mean daily intraocular pressure
reduction
from baseline between the two treatment arms. Secondary endpoints included the mean daily Intraocular Pressure at 1 and _POFT_ compared to baseline and the percentage of patients showing a mean Intraocular Pressure reduction from baseline greater than or equal to 15% or 20%.

Mean Intraocular Pressure at baseline was 22.7 +/ 2.0 and 22.1 +/ 2.6 mmHg in the Bimatoprost/Timolol and Latanoprost/Timolol Fixed Combination groups, respectively _PVAL_. Both treatments were effective in reducing the Intraocular Pressure from baseline. The mean Intraocular Pressure reduction was significantly greater in the Bimatoprost/Timolol group than in the Latanoprost/Timolol Fixed Combination group (
21.4%
versus
13.7%
, _PVAL_). A higher percentage of patients in the Bimatoprost/Timolol group showed a mean Intraocular Pressure reduction from baseline _CRI_ (72.3% versus 40.0%) and _CRI_ (61.7% versus 17.1%) compared to patients in the Latanoprost/Timolol Fixed Combination group.

Both Bimatoprost/Timolol and Latanoprost/Timolol Fixed Combination were more effective versus the monotherapy with prostaglandin analogues. Bimatoprost/Timolol demonstrated higher performance than Latanoprost/Timolol Fixed Combination in terms of relative Intraocular Pressure reduction.

body.title: Efficacy of the fixed combinations of bimatoprost or latanoprost plus timolol in patients uncontrolled with prostaglandin monotherapy: a multicenter, randomized, investigator-masked, clinical study.
